strategy: Introduce a gradient-boosted tree ensemble (e.g., XGBoost or LightGBM) with custom feature engineering that explicitly encodes survival-related temporal patterns—such as age-at-boarding, time since ticket purchase, and survival probability based on class and gender interactions. Features are derived from time-based groupings (e.g., passengers boarding in the same hour or day) and interaction terms (e.g., family size × class). This model leverages tree-based splitting to capture non-linear, high-dimensional interactions without relying on sequence or graph structures, offering interpretability and robustness to sparse data.
